syllabus_info.title: Cambridge International AS & A Level Mathematics

learning_objectives.description: formulate a simple statement involving a rate of change as a differential equation
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: The introduction and evaluation of a constant of proportionality, where necessary, is included.

learning_objectives.description: find by integration a general form of solution for a first order differential equation in which the variables are separable
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Including any of the integration techniques from topic 3.5 above.

learning_objectives.description: use an initial condition to find a particular solution
interpret the solution of a differential equation in the context of a problem being modelled by the equation.
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Where a differential equation is used to model a 'real-life' situation, no specialised knowledge of the context will be required.
